intro: Eriochrysis purpurata, commonly known as the purple seaweed plant, is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in sandy or coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, rosette-like growth habit and its ability to thrive in saline conditions. Its leaves are usually succulent and can range in color from green to purple, depending on environmental factors. Eriochrysis purpurata plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
